items.preText: 2.59pm Tamim Iqbal and Soumya Sarkar are out in the middle now, and Kemar Roach has the first new ball for West Indies. Round the wicket to start, with two slips in place. Anon06: "In getting Holder up the order, what are your thoughts on this lineup? Gayle, Ambris/Campbell, Hope, Hetmyer, Holder, Pooran, Russell, Nurse/Carlos, and 3 of Roach, Gabriel, Cottrell, and Thomas." -- No Evin Lewis? Holder at 5 looks a decent fit there - he could be a floater, coming in behind Pooran and Russell if the top four have laid a pretty good platform/not too many overs are remaining. Sathyen: "Darren Bravo's form is the real concern for West Indies going into the World cup as he has really struggled to score any decent runs since his comeback (though that 50 in the crucial second test against England was absolute gold on that dreaded Antigua pitch). With Hetmyer and Pooran in the middle they should be able to score more freely as both are excellent players of spin." 2.55pm Hello again. We're about two minutes from the start of Bangladesh's chase of 248.
items.text: full, angling into a fourth-stump line, driven to short extra-cover
items.shortText: Roach to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length, top of off stump, defended back towards the bowler
items.shortText: Roach to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length once more, and this keeps low, only gets up to about knee height a couple of inches outside off stump. Tamim is jumping and crouching all at the same time and he manages to jam his bat down and keep it out
items.shortText: Roach to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: length ball close to off stump, opens his bat face and dabs it towards second slip. Roach has overstepped marginally here
items.shortText: Roach to Tamim Iqbal, 1 no ball

items.text: back of a length, angling in towards off stump, and he clears his front leg and swipes it over the leaping mid-on fielder. Wasn't quite off the middle of the bat but he just clears the fielder
items.shortText: Roach to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
items.shortText: Roach to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, extra bounce on this occasion and Tamim gets his bat out of the way, lifting it high over his head
items.shortText: Roach to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText:
Here's Sheldon Cottrell, from left-arm over.

Rony Das: "It is all about pitch when we talk about Mustafiz. The moment the pitch has a bit of slowness, he is very effective, otherwise not. Maybe he will be thrashed in the beginning of the world cup when the pitches will be fresh. But at the later part he will do some magic when the pitches become slower due to overuse."
items.text: short and wide to start and Soumya frees his arms to punch it away through the big gap between backward point and cover point
items.shortText: Cottrell to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
items.shortText: Cottrell to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, angling into off stump, shuffles across to work it to the left of midwicket
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: full outside off, Soumya looks to drive through square cover and ends up playing a little early, off the inside half of the bat back to the bowler
items.shortText: Cottrell to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: length ball angling in towards middle and off, stays on the back foot and defends into the point region
items.shortText: Cottrell to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, lets it come on and eases it down to third man
items.shortText: Cottrell to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.preText:
Roach continues from round the wicket.

Anon06: "@Karthik: Thing is, before this series, Lewis could be the #1 choice for opening alongside Gayle. But he's been out of form for some time, and thus he faces a lot of dot balls. Not ideal when batting with Gayle. In addition, Ambris and Campbell have shown form. Ideally, Hope should open (his stats when opening says it all) but who would stabilize at 3? Definitely not Bravo. Chase possibly?"
items.text: too full, angling in towards off stump, whipped away to the right of mid-on
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball, angling into the fifth-stump line, defended into the covers
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: length ball angling in towards off stump, blocked into the covers
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Ajay: "Can the World Cup squad be altered only in case of any injuries or can be changed for any reason??" -- Until May 23, teams can make changes for any reason. After that, it's only for injuries.
items.text: back of a length angling in towards off stump, defended to mid-on
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: full, a bit of width, Soumya reaches for the ball and slices this drive over the point region
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs

items.text: length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and defends towards backward point
items.shortText: Roach to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: shortish, angling in towards middle stump and tucking Tamim up for room. Defends with soft hands into the leg side and looks for the quick single but Cottrell is alert, he closes it down quickly in his follow-through
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: shortish on off stump, jumps back and across to ride the bounce and works it away through square leg
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText:
One wide slip/gully in place for Cottrell.

Andrew : "Why are you guys worrying about the batting we have batting for days it's the bowling that's the main concern, doubt we can win this match today and this is our World Cup bowling line up!"
items.text: back of a length close to off stump, defends with soft hands, down to the man at gully
items.shortText: Cottrell to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: full on middle and leg, flicked to deep square leg, was briefly in the air
items.shortText: Cottrell to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: short outside off, Tamim gets up on his toes and cuts it hard, but straight to the man at backward point
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, no run
